post_text:
New Grab and Go Breakfast/Lunch Program procedures to take effect
Monday, April 6, 2020

Arlington Elementary will be eliminated as a pick-up site. Arlington families may utilize Chipperfield Elementary or Stroudsburg High School as a pick-up site.

Hours of distribution will be limited to 11:00 AM - 12:30 PM at the following locations: Hamilton Elementary, Chipperfield Elementary, and Stroudsburg High School.

Days for distribution at all sites are limited according to the following schedule through the month of April. Families may receive two days worth of breakfast/lunch upon request.

Pick up Days/Week of April 6: Mon., 4/6 and Wed., 4/8

Pick up Days/Week of April 13: Tues., 4/14 and Thurs., 4/16

Pick up Days/Week of April 20: Mon., 4/20, Wed., 4/22, and Fri., 4/24

Pick up Days/Week of April 27: Mon., 4/27, Wed., 4/29, and Fri., 5/1

Please refer daily to the District’s website for updates on this program and all District matters. We will continue to make adjustments to our procedures during this pandemic as safety demands.

post_text:
Dear Stroudsburg School Community. In light of the Governor’s order promoting social distancing and not meeting in groups of ten or more, this evening’s school board meeting scheduled for 7:00 PM has been canceled and will be rescheduled and readvertised as soon as possible. We will be looking to utilize an online platform that will allow for participation from board members and the public while honoring the Governor's order. Stay strong through these tough times. Sincerely,
Cosmas C. Curry
text:
Dear Stroudsburg School Community. In light of the Governor’s order promoting social distancing and not meeting in groups of ten or more, this evening’s school board meeting scheduled for 7:00 PM has been canceled and will be rescheduled and readvertised as soon as possible. We will be looking to utilize an online platform that will allow for participation from board members and the public while honoring the Governor's order. Stay strong through these tough times. Sincerely,
Cosmas C. Curry

post_text:
Stroudsburg Area School District will be offering Grab-and-Go bagged breakfast
and lunch meals for students during the COVID-19 School Closure. Breakfast and
lunch Grab-and-Go meals can be picked up between 10AM and 1PM, Monday
through Friday, beginning Tuesday March, 17 th . Pickup locations within the
District for Grab-and-Go meals will be Arlington, Chipperfield, Hamilton and
Stroudsburg High School no matter which school students attend within the
District. Parents can utilize any of the Schools mentioned. Grab-and-Go bagged
meals will be available daily, Monday through Friday as long as supplies last. Staff
will be directing parents to the proper pickup location at each of the schools
utilized for the Grab-and-Go service.

post_text:
Dear Stroudsburg School Community:

I want to alert you to a phone scam in the Lehigh Valley (See link below). If this group is targeting one school, I am sure they are targeting others. We are not offering such a program and if we did the roll out would not be via random phone calls. Thanks in advance for reading this and your support.

Sincerely, Cos Curry- Superintendent

Here is the link.

https://www.lehighvalleylive.com/news/2020/02/dont-give-out-your-credit-card-info-easton-area-tutoring-program-is-a-scam.html

post_text:
Dear Students, Staff, Parents, and Guardians: 6 May 2019

The Northampton County Community College is holding the 5th Annual Community Night Event on Tuesday, May 7, 2019, from 6:00 to 8:15 p.m., at the Monroe Campus in Tannersville.
New this year, is a pre-event concert featuring FLINTFACE. The mission of the group, FLINTFACE, is to teach resilience and healthy coping mechanisms through song and honest, unscripted communication. The concert is free to the public and will begin at 4:00 p.m. outside the Pocono Hall.
We hope you and your child/children will join us at Community Night!
Sincerely,

Cosmas Curry
Superintendent, Stroudsburg Area School District
text:
Dear Students, Staff, Parents, and Guardians: 6 May 2019

New this year, is a pre-event concert featuring FLINTFACE. The mission of the group, FLINTFACE, is to teach resilience and healthy coping mechanisms through song and honest, unscripted communication. The concert is free to the public and will begin at 4:00 p.m. outside the Pocono Hall.
We hope you and your child/children will join us at Community Night!
Sincerely,

Cosmas Curry
Superintendent, Stroudsburg Area School District

post_text:
I am happy to inform you that Stroudsburg High School has been named a Safe Sports School 1st Team for a three-year period, valid from November 1, through November 1, 2021.
This recognition not only spotlights the vital work our athletic trainers do, but positions the school as a leader in sports safety and a community concerned with its student athletes and their care. Congratulations specifically to Matt Shelton on this significant achievement!

SCHOOL BUS DRIVERS NEEDED
FOR STROUDSBURG AREA SCHOOL DISTRICT

CONSIDER GETTING YOUR CDL LICENSE
And help transport Stroudsburg students!

A GREAT TIME TO JOIN OUR NEXT CDL CLASS

DATE: MAY 7,8,9,10 TIME: 9AM to 1:00PM
FEE: $60.00
LOCALE: STROUDSBURG AREA SD TRANSPORTATION DEPT.
CALL: (570) 421-1992 FOR INFORMATION

AFTER ATTENDING THE ABOVE CLASS, YOU WILL NEED THE FOLLOWING:

- INTERVIEW
- CLEAN DRIVING RECORD AND CLEARANCES
(Criminal History, Child Abuse, FBI Fingerprint)
- PASS SCHOOL BUS DRIVER PHYSICAL
- OBTAIN PERMIT
- 6++ HOURS BEHIND THE WHEEL CDL CERTIFICATION
- DRIVING TEST (successful candidates will be paid for
in bus training and road test)

NOTE: bus runs and field trips in need of drivers
for the 2018-19 school year!

post_text:
Tickets for the High School Musical, "How To Succeed in Business Without Really Trying" are on sale in the main office everyday during school hours and this Wednesday immediately after school in front of the band room.
Prices are Student $8, Senior $10, Adult $12.
Performances are Friday, April 13 and Saturday, April 14 @ 7:30 and Sunday, April 15 @ 2:00
Ambitious window washer J. Pierrepont Finch decides to rise up the corporate ladder. With cleverness and a reference book’s instructions, he lands a job in the mail room of World Wide Wicket Company, and quickly gains promotions, outsmarting a scheming, sniveling rival, Bud Frump - who also happens to be the boss's nephew.
Set in the 60’s How to…is filled with songs, dance, businessmen and secretaries, that are sure to make you smile.

post_text: Congratulations to our champion spelling bee students who won 1st place in the Monroe County Hughes Spelling Bee! The Junior Level Champion is Casimir Morgan, 8th grader from Stroudsburg Junior High School and Senior Level Champion is Vasilia Briegel, 10th grader from Stroudsburg High School. The Championship trophy plaque will remain at the Stroudsburg High School. Thanks also to Mrs. Rose Marie Zito for her masterful administration of this great event!

post_text:
This year our 8th grade students are competing in the "What's so Cool About Manufacturing" Video Contest. They visited United Envelope and conducted surveys, taking video and still shots of the plant and workers. The culminating project was for them to create a video as an overview of the facility and it's workings. The video is up for voting and we need your help. There is no limit to the number of times you can vote in a day. Please help us by voting for Stroudsburg Junior High's video.

https://www.whatssocool.org/contests/northeast-pa/

Stroudsburg Schools will be closed Wednesday, March 7, 2018. School offices will also be closed.

Stroudsburg High School Gymnasium is a Red Cross shelter site. If you or anyone are in need of shelter, please feel welcomed by the the Stroudsburg School District and the Red Cross in our gymnasium.

Tomorrow's a school board work session and special meeting is canceled and will be rescheduled for Wednesday, March 21 at 7 PM in our high school cafeteria.

Thank you for your support! Please drive carefully if you have to drive it all.

post_text: School Safety Update: Wednesday, February 28 am. In an effort to continue to provide a positive drug-free school climate and one which focuses on learning, I'd like to inform parents that this morning, Stroudsburg junir High SChool and Senior High School partnered with neighboring Canine Police Units to conduct a random search of classrooms and lockers. Precautions were taken so that no students or staff had any interaction with the canines or their Police handler. This is part of our continual effort to provide a safe and secure environment for our students from any outside influences that might detract from our goal of providing the best education and school culture around. Thank you for your support.
text: School Safety Update: Wednesday, February 28 am. In an effort to continue to provide a positive drug-free school climate and one which focuses on learning, I'd like to inform parents that this morning, Stroudsburg junir High SChool and Senior High School partnered with neighboring Canine Police Units to conduct a random search of classrooms and lockers. Precautions were taken so that no students or staff had any interaction with the canines or their Police handler. This is part of our continual effort to provide a safe and secure environment for our students from any outside influences that might detract from our goal of providing the best education and school culture around. Thank you for your support.

post_text:
NEW School Safety Update! 8:58 PM Thursday!!!!:
In an effort to provide parents with the most current safety information and ease fears, please note the following:

If your son/daughter saw a social media post tonight stating that there will be a school shooting at "SMS" tomorrow at noon by an expelled student, please know that it was actually a repost, originally sent from Southern Middle School (SMS) in Southern York County, PA. The SMS referred to is NOT Stroudsburg Middle School. The "threat" is being investigated and at this point deemed not credible. Please know that we take all threats/comments/posts very seriously and deal with each one swiftly. We thank all of our students and parents for making us aware of these posts so that we can investigate. Student and staff safety continue to be our priority! Safety is everyone's responsibility! Thank you for your support.

post_text:
School Safety Update:
In an effort to provide parents with the most current safety information and ease concerns, please note the following: If your son/daughter saw a social media post last night or this morning stating that "SHS" is school I want", please know that it was actually a repost, originally sent weeks ago and was sent from a location out of the United States. The SHS referred to is NOT Stroudburg High School, but a school in Guam. The "threat" was taken care of and individual apprehended. Please know that we take all threats/comments/posts very seriously and deal with each one swiftly. Our students and staff safety continues to be our priority.

post_text: Our 8th grade enrichment students at Stroudsburg Junior High School recently visited United Envelope in Mount Pocono, PA, to learn more about the manufacturing industry and the many wonderful jobs available in that field. post_text: Congratulations Science Olympiad team members! The team completed in the North Pocono invitational yesterday and took first place. There were 21 schools and 30 teams from throughout PA and NY. Our students represented the school in a manner that would make all proud. Great job!

Thanks to all who participated in this year's Julianna V. Bolt Art Contest for the Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Celebration Breakfast. In all, Stroudsburg Area School District had 40 entries and the judges had a hard time narrowing down the selection. The entries are really great!!

Below are the results of the judging. Congratulations to all for your work!!!

Schools that participated:

East Stroudsburg High School South

Pocono Mountain High School West

Pocono Mountain High School East

Stroudsburg High School

Contest Winners:

First Place:

CHRISTIE LEE

Stroudsburg High School

Teacher: Ms. McKain

Second Place:

HANNA DEFINO

Stroudsburg High School

Teacher: Ms. McKain

Third Place:

TONY FLORES

Stroudsburg High School

Teacher: Ms. McKain

Honorable Mentions:

KAYLA PATNEY

Stroudsburg High School

Great job to Mrs. McKain and congratulations to our students!

post_text: I was talking with Mr. Larthey, Principal at the Stroudsburg Junior High School regarding instructional practice. I am highly encouraged by his report of the instructional practice occurring there. He was particularly excited about the teachers who invited him into their classrooms to witness the implementation of creative and innovative lessons utilizing technology. He has witnessed teachers using the station rotation model (AKA Hybrid Methodology), groupings based on formative assessment, differentiated lessons, student-centered instruction, and project-based instruction. Today he witnessed students using green screen technology, video, and video editing software to create skits based on dialogue they created. The skits will be shared between groups in Google Classroom, viewed like a flipped lesson, and then assessed. We look forward to all staff utilizing these processes and thank the early adapters for implementing district goals and doing what is best for our students!
text: I was talking with Mr. Larthey, Principal at the Stroudsburg Junior High School regarding instructional practice. I am highly encouraged by his report of the instructional practice occurring there. He was particularly excited about the teachers who invited him into their classrooms to witness the implementation of creative and innovative lessons utilizing technology. He has witnessed teachers using the station rotation model (AKA Hybrid Methodology), groupings based on formative assessment, differentiated lessons, student-centered instruction, and project-based instruction. Today he witnessed students using green screen technology, video, and video editing software to create skits based on dialogue they created. The skits will be shared between groups in Google Classroom, viewed like a flipped lesson, and then assessed. We look forward to all staff utilizing these processes and thank the early adapters for implementing district goals and doing what is best for our students!

post_text: Congratulations to Morey PTA who was awarded a$1000 grant from the National PTA and Bayer to hold a STEM Science Fair during the 2017/2018 school year. Bayer is providing tools and equipment for teachers and facilitators. The tentative date is May 10, 2018.
